House Bill/Resolution NO. PS00039
FULL TITLE : THE LATE SECRETARY ROBREDO, GOOD GOVERNANCE AND PEOPLE PARTICIPATION
SHORT TITLE : Jesse Robredo And Good Governance
ABSTRACT : Initially, Rep. Bordado thanked President Rodrigo Roa Duterte for declaring August 18, 2016 as a special nonworking day in Naga City to commemorate the 4th death anniversary of former City Mayor and Secretary of the Interior and Local Government Jesse M. Robredo. Rep. Bordado pointed out that Mayor Jesse Manalastas Robredo, the first Philippine mayor who had been conferred the prestigious Ramon Magsaysay Award (the Asian counterpart of the Nobel Prize), transformed Naga City and laid the groundwork for people’s participation therein. He said that the latter formulated the Good Governance Model which consisted of a progressive perspective, functional partnerships, and people’s participation; prioritized growth with equity; and established and encouraged partnerships with various public and private sectors. In summing up his speech, Rep. Bordado held that Mayor Robredo’s legacy of people’s participation in local governance was secure not only in his city but in the entire country; and remarked that the mayor did not even have to be buried in the Libingan ng Mga Bayani. MANIFESTATION OF REP. BELARO On behalf of his fellow-educators and fellow-Bicolanos, Rep. Belaro congratulated Rep. Bordado for his passionate and timely speech on Mayor Robredo whom he called a genuine hero. (SOURCE: House Journal No.10,pp.21-22)
